  • Constructor Details

    • Camera

      public Camera(Point p0, Vector vTo, Vector vUp)
      Constructs a camera with location, to and up vectors. The right vector is being calculated by the to and up vectors.
      Parameters:
      p0 - The camera's location.
      vTo - The direction to where the camera is looking.
      vUp - The direction of the camera's upper direction.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - When to and up vectors aren't orthogonal.

  • Method Details

      Returns the camera location.

    • setVPSize

      public Camera setVPSize(double width, double height)
      Chaining method for setting the view plane's size.
      Parameters:
      width - The new view plane's width.
      height - The new view plane's height.
      Returns:
      The camera itself.

    • setVPDistance

      public Camera setVPDistance(double distance)
      Chaining method for setting the distance between the camera and the view plane.
      Parameters:
      distance - The new distance between the camera and the view plane.
      Returns:
      The camera itself.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - When distance illegal.

    • constructRay

      public Ray constructRay(int nX, int nY, int j, int i)
      Constructs a ray through a given pixel on the view plane.
      Parameters:
      nX - Total number of pixels in the x dimension.
      nY - Total number of pixels in the y dimension.
      j - The index of the pixel on the x dimension.
      i - The index of the pixel on the y dimension.
      Returns:

      Parameters:
